00019 #ifdef DEBUG // Some useful macros for conditionally compiling debug features...
00020 
00021 // Design by contract - if (expr == false) then stop
00022 
00023 #  define U_ASSERT(expr)                 UTrace::suspend(); U_INTERNAL_ASSERT(expr);                UTrace::resume();
00024 #  define U_ASSERT_MINOR(a,b)            UTrace::suspend(); U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_MINOR(a,b);           UTrace::resume();
00025 #  define U_ASSERT_MAJOR(a,b)            UTrace::suspend(); U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_MAJOR(a,b);           UTrace::resume();
00026 #  define U_ASSERT_EQUALS(a,b)           UTrace::suspend(); U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_EQUALS(a,b);          UTrace::resume();
00027 #  define U_ASSERT_DIFFERS(a,b)          UTrace::suspend(); U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_DIFFERS(a,b);         UTrace::resume();
00028 #  define U_ASSERT_POINTER(ptr)          UTrace::suspend(); U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_POINTER(ptr);         UTrace::resume();
00029 #  define U_ASSERT_RANGE(a,x,b)          UTrace::suspend(); U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_RANGE(a,x,b);         UTrace::resume();
00030 
00031 #  define U_ASSERT_MSG(expr,info)        UTrace::suspend(); U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_MSG(expr,info);       UTrace::resume();
00032 #  define U_ASSERT_MINOR_MSG(a,b,info)   UTrace::suspend(); U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_MINOR_MSG(a,b,info)   UTrace::resume();
00033 #  define U_ASSERT_MAJOR_MSG(a,b,info)   UTrace::suspend(); U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_MAJOR_MSG(a,b,info)   UTrace::resume();
00034 #  define U_ASSERT_EQUALS_MSG(a,b,info)  UTrace::suspend(); U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_EQUALS_MSG(a,b,info)  UTrace::resume();
00035 #  define U_ASSERT_DIFFERS_MSG(a,b,info) UTrace::suspend(); U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_DIFFERS_MSG(a,b,info) UTrace::resume();
00036 #  define U_ASSERT_POINTER_MSG(ptr,info) UTrace::suspend(); U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_POINTER_MSG(ptr,info) UTrace::resume();
00037 #  define U_ASSERT_RANGE_MSG(a,x,b,info) UTrace::suspend(); U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_RANGE_MSG(a,x,b,info) UTrace::resume();
00038 
00039 // Manage test for memory corruption
00040 
00041 #  define U_MEMORY_TEST             UMemoryError memory;
00042 #  define U_MEMORY_TEST_COPY(o)                  memory = o.memory;
00043 #  define U_CHECK_MEMORY            U_CHECK_MEMORY_CLASS(memory);
00044 #  define U_CHECK_MEMORY_OBJ(o)     U_CHECK_MEMORY_CLASS((o).memory);
00045 
00046 // Manage info on execution of program
00047 
00048 #  define U_TRACE(level,args...)    UTrace utr(level, args);
00049 
00050 // NB: U_DUMP(), U_SYSCALL(), U_RETURN() sono vincolati alla presenza di U_TRACE()
00051 
00052 #  define U_INTERNAL_DUMP(args...) { if (utr.active)                      u_trace_dump(args); }
00053 #  define          U_DUMP(args...) { if (utr.active) { UTrace::suspend(); u_trace_dump(args); \
00054                                                        UTrace::resume(); } }
00055 
00056 #  define U_SYSCALL(name,format,args...)        (utr.trace_syscall("::"#name"("format")",args), \
00057                                                  utr.trace_sysreturn_type(::name(args)))
00058 
00059 #  define U_SYSCALL_NO_PARAM(name)              (utr.trace_syscall("::"#name"()",0), \
00060                                                  utr.trace_sysreturn_type(::name()))
00061 
00062 #  define U_SYSCALL_VOID(name,format,args...)   {utr.trace_syscall("::"#name"("format")",args); \
00063                                                  name(args); utr.trace_sysreturn(false,0);}
00064 
00065 #  define U_SYSCALL_VOID_NO_PARAM(name)         {utr.trace_syscall("::"#name"()",0); \
00066                                                  ::name(); utr.trace_sysreturn(false,0);}
00067 
00068 #  define U_RETURN(r)                  return (utr.trace_return_type((r)))
00069 #  define U_RETURN_STRING(str)         return (utr.trace_return("%.*S",U_STRING_TO_TRACE((str))),(str))
00070 #  define U_RETURN_OBJECT(obj)         return (utr.trace_return(  "%O",U_OBJECT_TO_TRACE((obj))),(obj))
00071 #  define U_RETURN_POINTER(ptr,type)   return ((type*)utr.trace_return_type((void*)(ptr)))
00072 #  define U_RETURN_SUB_STRING(substr)  U_RETURN_STRING(substr)
00073 
00074 // A mechanism that allow all objects to be registered with a central in-memory "database"
00075 // that can dump the state of all live objects
00076 
00077 #  define U_REGISTER_OBJECT_PTR(level,CLASS,ptr)  \
00078             if (UObjectDB::fd > 0 && \
00079                 (level) >= UObjectDB::level_active) { \
00080                   UObjectDB::registerObject(new UObjectDumpable_Adapter<CLASS>(level, #CLASS, ptr)); }
00081 
00082 #  define U_REGISTER_OBJECT(level,CLASS)  \
00083             if (UObjectDB::fd > 0 && \
00084                 (level) >= UObjectDB::level_active) { \
00085                   UObjectDB::registerObject(new UObjectDumpable_Adapter<CLASS>(level, #CLASS, this)); }
00086 
00087 #  define U_UNREGISTER_OBJECT(level,ptr) \
00088             if (UObjectDB::fd > 0 && \
00089                 (level) >= UObjectDB::level_active) { \
00090                 UObjectDB::unregisterObject(ptr); }
00091 
00092 #  define U_TRACE_REGISTER_OBJECT(level,CLASS,format,args...) if (UObjectDB::flag_new_object == false) U_SET_LOCATION_INFO; \
00093                                                                                                                                                                                 UObjectDB::flag_new_object =  false; \
00094                                                               U_REGISTER_OBJECT(level,CLASS) \
00095                                                               UTrace utr(level, #CLASS"::"#CLASS"("format")", args);
00096 
00097 #  define U_TRACE_UNREGISTER_OBJECT(level,CLASS)              U_UNREGISTER_OBJECT(level,this) \
00098                                                               UTrace utr(level, #CLASS"::~"#CLASS"()");
00099 
00100 // Manage location info for object allocation
00101 
00102 #  define U_NEW(args...)                  (U_SET_LOCATION_INFO, UObjectDB::flag_new_object = true, new args)
00103 #  define U_NEW_ULIB_OBJECT(obj,args...)  UObjectDB::flag_ulib_object = true, \
00104                                           obj = U_NEW(args), \
00105                                           UObjectDB::flag_ulib_object = false
00106 
00107 #  define U_ALLOCA(args...)               U_SET_LOCATION_INFO; args
00108 
00109 // Dump argument for exec()...
00110 
00111 #  define U_DUMP_EXEC(argv, envp) { uint32_t i; \
00112 for (i = 0; argv[i]; ++i) \
00113    { \
00114    U_INTERNAL_DUMP("argv[%2u] = %p %S", i, argv[i], argv[i]) \
00115    } \
00116 U_INTERNAL_DUMP("argv[%2u] = %p %S", i, argv[i], argv[i]) \
00117 if (envp) \
00118    { \
00119    for (i = 0; envp[i]; ++i) \
00120       { \
00121       U_INTERNAL_DUMP("envp[%2u] = %p %S", i, envp[i], envp[i]) \
00122       } \
00123    U_INTERNAL_DUMP("envp[%2u] = %p %S", i, envp[i], envp[i]) \
00124    } }
00125 
00126 // Dump attributes...
00127 
00128 #  define U_DUMP_ATTRS(attrs) { uint32_t i; for (i = 0; attrs[i]; ++i) { U_INTERNAL_DUMP("attrs[%2u] = %S", i, attrs[i]) } }

00132 #  define U_VFORK()                    -1
00133 #else
00134 #  define U_FORK()                     u_debug_fork(  ::fork())
00135 #  define U_VFORK()                    u_debug_vfork(::vfork())
00136 #endif

00139 #  define U_EXEC(pathname, argv, envp) u_debug_exec(pathname, argv, envp)

00192 #  define U_VFORK()                    ::vfork()

00195 #  define U_EXIT(exit_value)           ::exit(exit_value)
00196 #  define U_EXEC(pathname, argv, envp) u_exec_failed = false; ::execve(pathname, argv, envp); u_exec_failed = true; \
00197                                        U_WARNING("::execve(%s,%p,%p) = -1%R", pathname, argv, envp, NULL); \
00198                                        ::_exit(EX_UNAVAILABLE)

00200 // useful macros for conditionally compiling debug features in TESTING...
00201 
00202 #  if defined(U_TEST) && !defined(__CYGWIN__) && !defined(__MINGW32__)
00203 #     ifdef HAVE_ASSERT_H
00204 #        include <assert.h>
00205 #     else
00206       /*
00207       extern "C" { void __assert(const char* __assertion,
00208                                  const char* __file,
00209                                  int __line); }
00210       */
00211 #     endif
00212 #     define U_ASSERT(expr) \
00213          { if ((bool)(expr) == false) { __assert(#expr, __FILE__, __LINE__);  } }
00214 
00215 #     define U_ASSERT_MINOR(a,b)            U_ASSERT((a) < (b))
00216 #     define U_ASSERT_MAJOR(a,b)            U_ASSERT((a) > (b))
00217 #     define U_ASSERT_EQUALS(a,b)           U_ASSERT((a) == (b))
00218 #     define U_ASSERT_DIFFERS(a,b)          U_ASSERT((a) != (b))
00219 #     define U_ASSERT_POINTER(ptr)          U_ASSERT(ptr != 0)
00220 #     define U_ASSERT_RANGE(a,x,b)          U_ASSERT((x) >= (a) && (x) <= (b))
00221 
00222 #     define U_ASSERT_MSG(expr,info)        U_ASSERT(expr)
00223 #     define U_ASSERT_MINOR_MSG(a,b,info)   U_ASSERT((a) < (b))
00224 #     define U_ASSERT_MAJOR_MSG(a,b,info)   U_ASSERT((a) > (b))
00225 #     define U_ASSERT_EQUALS_MSG(a,b,info)  U_ASSERT((a) == (b))
00226 #     define U_ASSERT_DIFFERS_MSG(a,b,info) U_ASSERT((a) != (b))
00227 #     define U_ASSERT_POINTER_MSG(ptr,info) U_ASSERT(ptr != 0)
00228 #     define U_ASSERT_RANGE_MSG(a,x,b,info) U_ASSERT((x) >= (a) && (x) <= (b))
00229 #  else
00230 #     define U_ASSERT(expr)
00231 #     define U_ASSERT_MINOR(a,b)
00232 #     define U_ASSERT_MAJOR(a,b)
00233 #     define U_ASSERT_EQUALS(a,b)
00234 #     define U_ASSERT_DIFFERS(a,b)
00235 #     define U_ASSERT_POINTER(ptr)
00236 #     define U_ASSERT_RANGE(a,x,b)
00237 
00238 #     define U_ASSERT_MSG(expr,info)
00239 #     define U_ASSERT_MINOR_MSG(a,b,info)
00240 #     define U_ASSERT_MAJOR_MSG(a,b,info)
00241 #     define U_ASSERT_EQUALS_MSG(a,b,info)
00242 #     define U_ASSERT_DIFFERS_MSG(a,b,info)
00243 #     define U_ASSERT_POINTER_MSG(ptr,info)
00244 #     define U_ASSERT_RANGE_MSG(a,x,b,info)
00245 #  endif
00246 
00247 #endif /* DEBUG */

00249 #endif
